1.text: As a lily among the thorns,

2.text: So is my friend among the daughters!

3.text: As a citron among trees of the forest, So is my beloved among the sons, In his shade I delighted, and sat down, And his fruit is sweet to my palate.

4.text: He hath brought me in unto a house of wine, And his banner over me is love,

5.text: Sustain me with grape-cakes, Support me with citrons, for I am sick with love.

6.text: His left hand is under my head, And his right doth embrace me.

7.text: I have adjured you, daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes or by the hinds of the field, Stir not up nor wake the love till she please!

8.text: The voice of my beloved! lo, this—he is coming, Leaping on the mountains, skipping on the hills.

9.text: My beloved is like to a roe, Or to a young one of the harts. Lo, this—he is standing behind our wall, Looking from the windows, Blooming from the lattice.

10.text: My beloved hath answered and said to me, ‘Rise up, my friend, my fair one, and come away,

11.text: For lo, the winter hath passed by, The rain hath passed away—it hath gone.

12.text: The flowers have appeared in the earth, The time of the singing hath come, And the voice of the turtle was heard in our land,

13.text: The fig-tree hath ripened her green figs, And the sweet-smelling vines have given forth fragrance, Rise, come, my friend, my fair one, yea, come away.

14.text: My dove, in clefts of the rock, In a secret place of the ascent, Cause me to see thine appearance, Cause me to hear thy voice, For thy voice is sweet, and thy appearance comely.

15.text: Seize ye for us foxes, Little foxes—destroyers of vineyards, Even our sweet-smelling vineyards.

16.text: My beloved is mine, and I am his, Who is delighting among the lilies,

17.text: Till the day doth break forth, And the shadows have fled away, Turn, be like, my beloved, To a roe, or to a young one of the harts, On the mountains of separation!
